title: Case-Based Green Chemistry Decision-Making Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic chemistry theories, comprehension of sustainability concepts
context.additional_context: Focuses on cultivating decision-making skills through case studies to enable current secondary chemistry teachers to apply green chemistry concepts in actual classroom instruction.

learning_goals: Learners can explain four decision-making frameworks for evaluating the sustainability of chemical phenomena.
Learners can propose three or more alternatives applying green chemistry principles to given industrial cases.
Learners can analyze the environmental impact of chemical processes using Life Cycle Assessment (LCA) tools.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
